Articles.Content:
I've been away from KSP for a while, so forgive me if I've forgotten a few tricks.

I have two docking ports that won't engage when I stick them together, one vehicle is my Duna exploration vessel and the other is a shuttle delivering fuel and crew before they depart for Duna, the duna ship is huge and was not easy to launch in the first place, the shuttle is less vital, but is an expensive do-over if I have to launch it again.  Is there a trick to getting the docking ports to lock?  I tried turning SAS on and off, as well as reloading the game, nothing seems to work, and now my shuttle is starting to run low on mono, so I don't know how many more attempts it can make.
Without a picture we may not be able to help you, but you mention the ship is "huge." Does this mean you used Sr. docking ports? Those are frequently put on upside down.

nope, I checked that.

Actually, I'm using FusTek IACBMs, it's pretty obvious which way they go.  I also made sure that the guide horns are aligned correctly, since that does matter with these ports.

Edited October 5, 2016 by Capt. Hunt
Never used those parts before, I suggest asking on that thread. They'll likely want your output_log.txt and/or craft file(s) and/or persistent.sfs

I suspect it was a fluke, probably a bad port on the shuttle. I managed to dock another vessel to the same port on the Duna ship.  I've seen it happen with other types of ports too, so I don't think it's a problem with the IACBM.  I seem to remember there being some trick to re-enable malfunctioning ports though. 

Edited October 5, 2016 by Capt. Hunt
